did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Wilbur F. Thompson Collection contains histories written by Wilbur F. Thompson, and genealogical information relevant to Wilbur F. Thompson.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the G&B Cultural Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item Description, Date], Wilbur F. Thompson Collection, [Item no., Box no.], G&B Cultural Center, Wilton, Conn.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Wilbur Fiske Thompson (1854-1934) was born in New York, lived briefly in Wisconsin, and is buried in Danbury, Conn., where he spent most of his adult life. He was a carpenter and an amateur historian who wrote extensively on the history of Georgetown. He grew up in Georgetown, as had his mother Mary Bennett before him. Wilbur's father found work in Georgetown first as a blacksmith, and then a machinist at the Gilbert & Bennett Mfg. Co. As a young man in the 1880s, Wilbur too worked at the Gilbert & Bennett Mfg. Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Wilbur F. Thompson Collection contains newspaper clippings and typescripts of Wilbur F. Thompson's articles on the history of Georgetown, as well newspaper clippings and genealogical research on Wilbur F. Thompson himself.
Wilbur F. Thompson's articles were collected and published with an introduction and additional materials by editor Irene Baldwin as "Georgetown."
